abstract: Different circuit courts disagree on the right of a secured creditor to “credit bid” its claim in the auction sale of a debtor’s property when the sale is part of the debtor’s Chapter 11 plan.
snippet: Different circuit courts disagree on the right of a secured creditor to “credit bid” its claim in the auction sale of a debtor’s property when the sale is part of the debtor’s Chapter 11 plan.
lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court probably will not agree to hear the appeal in RadLAX Gateway Hotel, LLC v. Amalgamated Bank, but it should. And not for the reasons the debtors argue in their petition to the court.

headline.main: Appeals Courts Split on Creditors’ Right to Bid in Auction Sales
